info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 22 at 4:58PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT MOORE...SOUTHWESTERN HARNETT... SOUTHWESTERN LEE...NORTH CENTRAL HOKE AND SOUTHWESTERN CHATHAM COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EST... At 458 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Seagrove, or 13 miles northwest of Carthage, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Southern Pines, Carthage, Pinehurst, Aberdeen, Whispering Pines, Robbins, Taylortown, Vass, Cameron, and Harpers Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This thunderstorm is producing an excessive amount of deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter indoors and stay away from windows. If you cannot seek shelter indoors, an enclosed vehicle can provide safe shelter. Deadly lightning strikes can occur well ahead of an approaching storm, prior to the arrival of rain and wind.
